content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) that smelts iron ore into iron plates.
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) that stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) that extracts iron ore.
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) that transfers ore from the extraction point.
– Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) that delivers extracted ore.
– Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) that stores delivered ore.
– Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) channeling ore to a remote branch.
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) that moves ore along the intermediate belt.
– Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) receiving ore for further routing.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) that smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) processing science packs.
– Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5) drawing water.
– Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5) supplying steam.
– Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) generating electricity.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) configured for pipe production.
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) storing crafted pipes.
– Electricity network via small electric poles interlinking facility components.

### Pipe Groups (Fluid Pipelines)
Consists of the following interconnected pipeline sections with updated fluid_system identifiers:
– PipeGroup at position (8.5, 5.5) with fluid_system == 108540:
  • Pipe (position: 8.5, 5.5)
  • Pipe (position: 8.5, 6.5)
– PipeGroup at position (10.5, 4.5) with fluid_system == 108541:
  • Pipe (position: 10.5, 4.5)
  • Pipe (position: 11.5, 4.5)
  • Pipe (position: 12.5, 4.5) with additional segments.
– PipeGroup at position (–9.5, 9.5) with fluid_system == 108544:
  • Pipe (position: –9.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: –8.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: –8.5, 8.5) and subsequent segments.
– PipeGroup at position (2.5, 9.5) with fluid_system == 108547:
  • Pipe (position: 2.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: 3.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: 3.5, 10.5)
  • Pipe (position: 3.5, 11.5)
  • Pipe (position: 2.5, 10.5)
– PipeGroup at position (10.5, 9.5) with fluid_system == 108548:
  • Pipe (position: 10.5, 9.5)
  • Pipe (position: 10.5, 8.5)
  • Pipe (position: 9.5, 15.5) with further segments (e.g., at positions (9.5, 16.5), (6.5, 18.5) and (7.5, 18.5))
– PipeGroup at position (1.5, 11.5) with fluid_system == 108553:
  • Pipe (position: 1.5, 11.5)
  • Pipe (position: 1.5, 13.5)
  • Pipe (position: 0.5, 13.5) with additional segments.
– PipeGroup at position (–1.5, 17.5) with fluid_system == 108564:
  • Pipe (position: –1.5, 17.5)
– PipeGroup at position (6.5, 16.5) with fluid_system == 108567:
  • Pipe (position: 6.5, 16.5)
– PipeGroup at position (–1.5, 21.5) with fluid_system == 108568:
  • Pipe (position: –1.5, 21.5)
– Additional integrated components:
  • ElectricityGroup (id: 33569) with small electric poles (e.g., at positions (3.5, –2.5), (5.5, 0.5), (6.5, 0.5), etc.)
  • Belt connections linking the Burner Mining Drill setup (e.g., Belt at (–15.5, –49.5) and (–15.5, –47.5))

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Candidate PipeGroup Connection Failures
  – Repeated connection attempts using candidate PipeGroups with fluid_system identifiers [93796, 93938, 94080, 94222, 94506, 94648, 94790, 94932, 95074, 95216, 95358, 95500, 95642, 95784, 95926, 96068, 96210, 96352, 96494, 96636, 96778, 96920, 97062, 97204, 97346, 97488, 97630, 97772, 97914, 98056, 98198, 98340, 98482, 98624, 98766, 98908, 99050, 99192, 99334, 99476, 99618, 99902, 100044, 100186, 100328, 100470, 100612, 100754, 100896, 101038, 101180, 101322, 101464, 101606, 101748, 101890, 102032, 102174, 102316, 102458, 102600, 102742, 102884, 103026, 103168, 103310, 103452, 103594, 103736, 103878, 104020, 104162, 104304, 104446, 104588, 104730, 104872, 105014, 105156, 105298, 105440, 105582, 105724, 105866, 106008, 106150, 106292, 106434, 106576, 106718, 106860, 107002, 107144, 107286, 107428, 107570, 107712, 107854, 107996, 108138, 108280, 108422] near (–1.5, 17.5) have consistently failed.
  – Tip: Verify candidate existence and correct positioning before initiating connection routines.

• Manual Pipe Placement Issues
  – Tip: Ensure the target tile is unoccupied and available prior to attempting pipe placement.

• Assembling Machine Resource and Power Issues
  – Tip: Supply stable power and the required resource (e.g., iron-plate) to the Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5).

• Power Generation and Fluid Supply Connection Issues
  – Tip: Confirm proper fluid inputs and connectivity for both the Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) and the Steam Engine at (5.5, 5.5).

• Burner Mining Drill Fuel Shortage
  – Tip: Provide sufficient fuel to the Burner Mining Drill in the Iron Ore Mining Setup at (–16.0, –51.0).

• Insufficient Inventory for Fluid Connections
  – Tip: Verify adequate allocation of pipes and connection components prior to establishing fluid connections.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.  
   • Success Mode: Returns the located entity.  
   • Failure Mode: Raises an exception if the entity is not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction to correct its alignment.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of the resource into the target inventory; returns the updated target on success.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection; raises an exception if conditions are not met.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (–7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s steam input.
• pipe_count (int) – Tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
